channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ハースト社のサンアントニオ・エクスプレス・ニュースとMySA.comのジャーナリストが組合結成の意向を示し、2024年に組合結成を発表するテキサス州4番目のニュースルームとなる（Josh Peck/TPR）
item.description:
Josh Peck / TPR:
Journalists at Hearst's San Antonio Express-News and MySA.com say they intend to unionize, becoming the fourth Texas newsroom to announce a union effort in 2024  —  Journalists at the San Antonio Express-News and MySA.com announced their intent to unionize on Wednesday …

item.title: BuzzFeed、2021年に3億ドルで買収したComplexをライブストリーミングショッピングプラットフォームNtwrkに1億860万ドルで売却、BuzzFeedは従業員の16％を解雇予定（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
BuzzFeed sells Complex, which it acquired for $300M in 2021, to livestream shopping platform Ntwrk for $108.6M; BuzzFeed plans to lay off 16% of its workforce  —  - The Wall Street Journal reported that BuzzFeed is also looking to possibly sell its social media food brand Tasty.

item.title: ニューズマックスは、ニューヨーク・ポスト紙の論説委員や他の右寄りの出版社とともに、名誉毀損で訴えることを容易にするフロリダ州の2つの法案を批判している（Corbin Bolies/The Daily Beast）。
item.description:
Corbin Bolies / The Daily Beast:
Newsmax joins the New York Post's editorial board and other right-leaning outlets criticizing a pair of Florida bills making it easier to sue for defamation  —  The cable channel joins a growing list of right-wing outlets bashing Florida GOP legislation that takes square aim at the news media.

item.title: ローカルニュースに5年間で5億ドルを投資する慈善活動「プレス・フォワード」によると、設立済みの6つの支部に新たに11のコミュニティが加わった（Kristen Hare/Poynter）
item.description:
Kristen Hare / Poynter:
Press Forward, the philanthropic initiative to invest $500M over five years in local news, says 11 new communities have joined six established chapters  —  11 more communities have joined the movement  —  On Wednesday, Press Forward announced an expansion of its local chapters at the opening of the Knight Media Forum.

item.title: AIボイスクローン技術が政治家のなりすましに使われているイレブンラボのプロフィール。スタートアップの従業員40人のうち5人が信頼と安全に専念している（Margi Murphy/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Margi Murphy / Bloomberg:
A profile of ElevenLabs, whose AI voice cloning tech is being used to spoof politicians; five of the startup's 40 employees are dedicated to trust and safety  —  ElevenLabs' technology is already being used to spoof political candidates and promote scammy products.

item.title: ABCレポート：英国雑誌のデジタル販売部数は前年比15.4％増の1版平均260万部、うち120万部はReadlyなどによる「読み放題」販売（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
ABC report: UK magazines' digital sales rose 15.4% YoY to an average of 2.6M per edition, including 1.2M from “all you can read” sales via Readly and others  —  UK magazine titles report surge in access to digital editions according to ABC.  —  Digital sales of UK magazines rose 15.4% year …

item.title: イスラエルに拠点を置くBRIAは、ゲッティが支援するAI画像生成スタートアップで、18のストックプロバイダーから1B以上の画像をライセンスしており、ピュブリシスなどから2400万ドルのシリーズAを調達した（Katie Paul/Reuters）
item.description:
Katie Paul / Reuters:
Israel-based BRIA, a Getty-backed AI image generation startup that licenses 1B+ images from 18 stock providers, raised a $24M Series A from Publicis and others  —  A “responsible” AI image generation startup backed by stock photo provider Getty Images (GETY.N) has raised $24 million in a Series …

item.title: 情報筋アマゾンは、広告と製品への取り組みをプライム・ビデオに集中させる広範な取り組みの一環として、FASTサービスFreeveeを数週間以内に閉鎖する予定（Mark Stenberg/Adweek）
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Adweek:
Sources: Amazon plans to shut its FAST service Freevee in the coming weeks, as part of a broader effort to focus its ad and product efforts on Prime Video  —  The service has become redundant following the introduction of ads to Prime Video  —  Amazon is planning to sunset its free …

item.title: Apple、iOS 17.2以降でNBA、NHL、プレミアリーグなどのスコアとスタッツを提供する無料アプリ「Apple Sports」を米国、カナダ、英国でデビュー（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Apple debuts Apple Sports, a free app offering scores and stats for the NBA, NHL, Premier League, and more, in the US, Canada, and the UK, on iOS 17.2 or later  —  Game on!  Apple launched a free standalone app for sports fans, Apple Sports, which is engineered to fire scores and stats to your iPhone as quickly as possible.

item.title: RedBird IMIのニュース投資へのアプローチ、The Telegraph記者からの反発、The Messenger立ち上げの教訓などについてジェフ・ザッカーにQ&A（Lachlan Cartwright/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Lachlan Cartwright / The Hollywood Reporter:
Q&A with Jeff Zucker about RedBird IMI's approach to news investments, backlash from The Telegraph journalists, lessons from The Messenger launch, and more  —  Two years after his ouster from the network, the mogul explains why his investment firm RedBird IMI is snapping up media properties at a frantic clip.

item.title: FTCの書簡：ツイッターは、「ツイッター・ファイル」執筆者が同社のシステムに直接アクセスするのを阻止したため、データ取り扱い制限命令に違反しなかった（Cat Zakrzewski/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Cat Zakrzewski / Washington Post:
FTC letter: Twitter did not violate an order restricting its data practices, as staff prevented the “Twitter Files” writers from directly accessing its systems  —  After investigating his handling of the ‘Twitter Files’ for more than a year, the agency found no evidence the company violated consent order

item.title: 米国第2位のラジオ放送局Audacyが破産から脱却し、17億ドルの負債を削減することを米裁判所が承認（Amelia Pollard/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Amelia Pollard / Bloomberg:
Filing: a US court gives Audacy, the second-largest radio broadcaster in the US, approval to exit bankruptcy, slashing ~$1.7B of its debt in a restructuring  —  - Soros Fund Management slated to own largest stake in company  — Firm to slash $1.7 billion of debt through restructuring plan

item.title: メフディ・ハサンが『ガーディアン』US版のレギュラー・コラムニストに加わった。同誌はここ数カ月で人員を増強し、著名なライターや調査部門を加えている（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Mehdi Hasan joins The Guardian US as a regular columnist; the outlet has been staffing up in recent months, adding well-known writers and an investigative unit  —  The Scoop  —  The progressive pundit Mehdi Hasan is joining The Guardian following his abrupt departure from MSNBC.

item.title: ディズニー・プレジデント・オブ・アジア太平洋のルーク・カン氏とのQ&A：アジアのエンターテインメントビジネス、ディズニーのストリーミング戦略の進化、Disney+の成長、広告などについて（Patrick Brzeski/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Patrick Brzeski / The Hollywood Reporter:
Q&A with Disney President of Asia-Pacific Luke Kang on the Asian entertainment business, evolving Disney's streaming strategy, growing Disney+, ads, and more  —  Luke Kang shares how the media giant has come to its streaming strategy for the region and his current views on major content markets like China, South Korea and Japan.

item.title: 中国のライブストリーミング・タレント・エージェンシーはどのようにしてインフルエンサーをリクルートしているのか？
item.description:
Viola Zhou / Rest of World:
How livestreaming talent agencies in China recruit influencers, often signing them to multiyear contracts that cost tens of thousands of dollars to breach  —  Chinese livestream agencies promise influencers fame and money, but end up trapping them in multi-year contracts.
